meanings.definition: Moving in a direction opposite to that of cyclonic rotation.
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast predicted an anticyclonic pattern for the upcoming week.
meanings.sent2: The anticyclonic winds brought clear skies and sunny weather to the region.
meanings.sent3: The anticyclonic breeze was so strong that it blew the hat off my head!
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like an anticyclonic force amidst the chaos of the office.
meanings.sent5: The anticyclonic nature of his thoughts always led him to take the road less traveled.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an area of high atmospheric pressure characterized by clockwise wind circulation in the Northern Hemisphere and counterclockwise circulation in the Southern Hemisphere.
meanings.sent1: The anticyclonic conditions over the ocean created calm seas for the sailors.
meanings.sent2: Anticyclonic weather systems often bring dry and stable conditions to an area.
meanings.sent3: The anticyclonic pressure system decided to take a vacation, leaving the weather in chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted like an anticyclonic force, bringing peace to the team.
meanings.sent5: The anticyclonic atmosphere in the room made it feel like time had stopped.
